ThighsLVKneelingLegCurlH.name: Lever Kneeling Leg Curl (plate loaded)
ThighsLVKneelingLegCurlH.preparation: Mount machine by placing supporting knee on horizontal pad and other leg under roller pad with knee against vertical pad. Grip handles and place forearm on padded arm rest.
ThighsLVKneelingLegCurlH.execution: Raise ankle to back of thigh by flexing knee. Lower ankle until knee is straight. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
ThighsLVKneelingLegCurlH.comments: Dorsal flexion of ankle reduces active insufficiency of Gastrocnemius allowing it to assist in knee flexion.

ThighsLVLyingLegCurlH.name: Lever Lying Leg Curl (plate loaded)
ThighsLVLyingLegCurlH.preparation: Facing bench, stand between bench and lever pads. Lie prone on bench with knees just beyond edge of bench and lower legs under lever pads. Grasp handles.
ThighsLVLyingLegCurlH.execution: Raise lever pad to back of thighs by flexing knees. Lower lever pads until knees are straight. Repeat.
ThighsLVLyingLegCurlH.comments: Keep torso on bench to reduce hyperextension of lower back. Most machines are angled at users hip to position hamstring in more favorable mechanical position. If angle is at much greater angle than one illustrated, Rectus Femoris will less likely be involved as Antagonist Stabilizer. Dorsal flexion of ankle reduces active insufficiency of Gastrocnemius allowing it to assist in knee flexion. See Knee flexion abduction force vector diagram.

ThighsLVAlternatingLyingLegCurlH.name: Lever Alternating Lying Leg Curl (plate loaded)
ThighsLVAlternatingLyingLegCurlH.preparation: Facing bench, stand between bench and lever pads. Lie prone on bench with knees just beyond edge of bench and lower legs under lever pads. Grasp handles.
ThighsLVAlternatingLyingLegCurlH.execution: Raise one lever pad to back of thigh by flexing knee. Lower lever pad until knee is straight. Raise and lower other leg pad. Continue by alternating legs.
ThighsLVAlternatingLyingLegCurlH.comments: Keep torso on bench to reduce hyperextension of lower back. Most machines are angled at users hip to position hamstring in more favorable mechanical position. If angle at hip is significantly bent, Rectus Femoris will less likely be involved as Antagonist Stabilizer. Dorsal flexion of ankle reduces active insufficiency of Gastrocnemius allowing it to assist in knee flexion. See Knee flexion abduction force vector diagram.

ThighsLVLyingLegCurlRevHyperMachPL.name: Lever Lying Leg Curl (on reverse hyper-extension machine, plate loaded)
ThighsLVLyingLegCurlRevHyperMachPL.preparation: Place lower legs between pads with feet on bar. Lay torso and waist on bench and grasp handles.
ThighsLVLyingLegCurlRevHyperMachPL.execution: Raise lever back and up by flexing knees. Lower lever until knees are straight. Repeat.
ThighsLVLyingLegCurlRevHyperMachPL.comments: Dorsal flexion of ankle reduces active insufficiency of Gastrocnemius, allowing it to assist in knee flexion. See Knee flexion abduction force vector diagram.

ThighsLVSeatedLegCurlH.name: Lever Seated Leg Curl (plate loaded)
ThighsLVSeatedLegCurlH.preparation: Sit on apparatus with back against padded back support. Push hand lever to lower leg pads. Place legs in between pads. Release hand lever gradually. Grasp handles to sides with each hand.
ThighsLVSeatedLegCurlH.execution: Pull lever to back of thighs by flexing knees. Return lever until knees are straight. Repeat.
ThighsLVSeatedLegCurlH.comments: Dorsal flexion of ankle reduces active insufficiency of Gastrocnemius allowing it to assist in knee flexion.

ThighsLVSingleLegSeatedLegCurlHammer.name: Lever Single Leg Seated Leg Curl (plate loaded)
ThighsLVSingleLegSeatedLegCurlHammer.preparation: Sit on seat with back against padded back support. Push hand lever to lower leg pads. Place one leg in between pads. Place other leg on top of upper most pad bar. Release hand lever gradually. Grasp handles to sides with each hand.
ThighsLVSingleLegSeatedLegCurlHammer.execution: Pull padded lever to back of thighs as far as possible by flexing knee. Return padded lever until knee is straight. Change legs and repeat for opposite leg.
ThighsLVSingleLegSeatedLegCurlHammer.comments: Allow resting leg on top to ride bar down and up throughout exercise. Dorsal flexion of ankle reduces active insufficiency of Gastrocnemius allowing it to assist in knee flexion.

ThighsLVStraightLegDeadlift.name: Lever Straight Leg Deadlift (plate loaded)
ThighsLVStraightLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand between lever handles with shoulder width or narrower stance. Squat down and grasp handles to each side. Stand upright with arms straight down to sides.
ThighsLVStraightLegDeadlift.execution: With knees straight, bow forward by bending hips. Bend waist as stirrups approach lowest position. Lift lever by extending hips and waist until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Repeat.
ThighsLVStraightLegDeadlift.comments: Begin with very light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate adaptation. Throughout lift, keep arms and knees straight. Do not stand behind pulleys. Do not pause or bounce at bottom of lift. Lower back may bend slightly during full hip flexion phase. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch throughout hamstrings and low back. Full range of motion will vary from person to person depending on flexibility. See Dangerous Exercise Essay. Also see Straight Back Straight Leg Deadlift.
ThighsLVStraightLegDeadlift.stabilizers: latissimusdorsi, trapeziusupper, trapeziusmiddle, levatorscapulae, trapeziuslower, rhomboids

ThighsLVStrBackStrLegDeadlift.name: Lever Straight-back Straight-leg Deadlift (plate loaded)
ThighsLVStrBackStrLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand between lever handles with shoulder width or narrower stance. Squat down and grasp handles to each side. Stand upright with arms straight down to sides.
ThighsLVStrBackStrLegDeadlift.execution: With knees and back straight, bow forward by bending hips until hamstrings are tight, or just before lower back bends. Raise body upright by extending hips until standing. Pull shoulders back slightly at top of lift if rounded. Repeat.
ThighsLVStrBackStrLegDeadlift.comments: Throughout lift, keep arms, knees, and back straight. Do not pause or bounce at bottom of lift. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch. Full range of motion will vary from person to person depending on flexibility. Also see Straight Leg Deadlift.
ThighsLVStrBackStrLegDeadlift.stabilizers: trapeziusupper, trapeziusmiddle, erectorspinae, levatorscapulae, trapeziuslower, rhomboids
